Peter, that's strange I have not heard of anyone not being able to run it w=
ho had everything else correct.  It sounds like you have the right software=
 and hardware so I'm not sure what happened.  I will look into it.

ken


-=
-- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "petar_chervenski" <petar_chervenski@...> wrote=
:
>
> I downloaded it and installed it, but couldn't run it. It gave me the=
 "Send/Don't Send" error message and that was it. I have all other componen=
ts installed, like the XNA. I have an AMD Athlon64 x2 machine with 1 GB or =
RAM and an Nvidia GeForce 8600 GTS video card. Please tell me if you need m=
ore info to resolve the problem. Did you had other such reports except mine=
? Perhaps I have a poorly configured machine.  
> 
> Peter
> 
> --- In neat=
@yahoogroups.com, "Kenneth Stanley" <kstanley@> wrote:
> >
> > I am pleased=
 to announce that GAR is now released and available at:
> > 
> > http://gar=
.eecs.ucf.edu
> > 
> > As some of you know, GAR can be played single player=
 or multiplayer online.  In the multiplayer mode, the evolution of CPPN-con=
trolled weapons in the game is influenced by all the players online, making=
 it (as far as I know) the first example of real online content evolution i=
n a multiplayer game.  The algorithm is called cgNEAT, for content-generati=
ng NEAT.
> > 
> > Both game client and online server (for hosting your own =
galaxy) are available.  We are also hosting an official GAR server with hig=
h capacity because of our fast connection at UCF.
> > 
> > This project was=
 very complex, in effect involving the implementation of not just a game, b=
ut an online service and a novel evolutionary algorithm, so there could be =
a few unanticipated hiccups in the first release, but I think you will find=
 it entertaining and interesting.
> > 
> > ken
> >
>
